reviews.text: Every was good. The only complaint is the entrance and 1 bathroom are very tight.
Los mejores, cada vez que vengo de Pensilvania a queens a visitar mi familia, siempre vengo a este restaurante, excelente calidad de comida, y muy buena atenci√≥n. Les recomiendo la sopa de marisco
Yellow rice is always hard don‚Äôt matter what day or time I buy it had to throw my plate away couldn‚Äôt eat it but the bake chicken is always good there.

This morning I had breakfast with my 18 month old and husband. I'm sorry I didn't get her name but the server was amazing. She was kind, attentive, and engaging. As a neighborhood staple, you expect at times for service to be hands off, where the food always hits home, but when you sprinkle in the show of love to diners and compassion it beats spending money at any fine dining spot. Thank you Rico Pollo for showing us what a great experience is close to home. Excellent food and excellent service.

Worst place to eat. They over charge you for everything. The service is disgusting. The Manager don‚Äôt care about the clients. The chicken wasn‚Äôt fully cooked. They even charge you for the salad dressing. Not coming over. I‚Äôm

I wandered into Rico Pollo II on a humid Saturday afternoon, all sweaty from the long walk through Cypress Hills, but drawn by the bright yellow fa√ßade and the aroma of roasting chicken spinning in the open-kitchen window. The salt-and-spice scent hit me the moment I stepped in, and for a second I felt miles away from the city‚Äîmore like I‚Äôd stepped into someone‚Äôs home kitchen in the Dominican countryside.

Inside, the place was warm‚Äînot just in temperature, but in mood. The staff greeted me with a friendly nod and a joke between themselves about ‚Äú¬øQui√©n est√° comiendo m√°s hoy?‚Äù which I took as good omen. I ordered the pollo al horno with maduros and a side of rice & habichuelas. When it arrived, the plate was generous: the chicken skin crisp and caramelized, with a caramel-brown hue from the oven‚Äôs heat, the maduros sweet but not overly sticky, and the rice firm yet buoyant, holding its own.

As I ate, I noticed families chatting over big trays of food, kids laughing in a corner, elders discussing their day‚Äîor maybe their week. It felt lively without being chaotic. My first bite of the chicken yielded a faint crack of the skin, followed by juicy, well-seasoned meat. The sauce on the side (a house-madeji) offered a tangy contrast, and I found myself closing my eyes for a second, just savoring it.

What stood out: this was comfort food with intention. I wasn‚Äôt just grabbing a quick bite; I was sitting into a moment. The price was fair for Brooklyn, and I left with a doggy-bag in hand (the portions were plenty).

If I were to pick one thing to note: the interior decor is basic‚Äîfunctional, clean, but not fancy. If you‚Äôre looking for a polished bistro aesthetic, this isn‚Äôt it. But if you want honest, full-hearted food and a place that makes you feel welcome, Rico Pollo II does it wonderfully. I‚Äôll definitely return next time I‚Äôm in the neighborhood.
Asked for a soup was under the weather and when I get home it‚Äôs one piece of chicken and all carrots no Fideo noodles waste of my money it was like boiling water and adding carrots

Los tostones parec√≠an chips de los duros que estaban, se nota que son frezzados, hasta pegados estaban. Segunda vez que me pasa lo de las habichuelas. No vuelvo a ordenar m√°s.

My husband and I stumbled upon Rico Pollo 2 while exploring Highland Park and decided to grab a bite. The counter-front food looked okaish and my husband decided to grab his plate of chicken, rice, and beans from the counter. I ordered the Pina Colada and a Pechugafongo, which were good but didn't quite have the same fresh-from-the-kitchen feel. The food was decent overall. If you're there, trust the food on display at the counter; it's the freshest! I'd give it a solid 3.5 stars. A good, no-frills spot for a quick and satisfying meal.

The food is great. The prices are very good. The drinks are pretty good, too.  Great local spot to eat at.

Title: A Culinary Gem in Brooklyn - Rico Pollo II Delights!

Review:

I have been a loyal customer of Rico Pollo II in Brooklyn for quite some time now, and I must say that my dining experience has always been exceptional. This hidden gem never fails to impress with its delectable Latin cuisine, and I am thrilled to share my five-star review.

First and foremost, the service at Rico Pollo II is top-notch. The staff is incredibly friendly, attentive, and efficient, ensuring that my take-out orders are promptly prepared. Their dedication to customer satisfaction is truly commendable.

But what truly sets Rico Pollo II apart is the outstanding quality of their food. Each dish bursts with authentic Latin flavors that transport me to a world of culinary delight. The roasted chicken is an absolute must-try; tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned, it's a true masterpiece. Accompanied by their flavorful white rice with beans, every bite is a symphony of tastes and textures.

Additionally, the chicken and seafood soups at Rico Pollo II are simply divine. The hearty broth, brimming with fresh ingredients, is a comforting and soul-nourishing delight. Every spoonful is packed with rich flavors that leave me craving more.

In conclusion, Rico Pollo II is a haven for anyone seeking scrumptious Latin cuisine in Brooklyn. The consistently fast and efficient service, combined with their masterfully cooked dishes, make it an unbeatable dining experience. Whether you're a fan of their roasted chicken, white rice with beans, or their sensational soups, your taste buds will thank you for choosing Rico Pollo II. Don't miss out on this culinary treasure!

Five stars all the way - Rico Pollo II, you have won my heart and my taste buds!

Roach in my food so I‚Äôm no longer a customer after two years. I have been going to this establishment for over two years. Been a family staple; getting rotisserie chicken during the weekend and just enjoy some well cooked food. My best friends favorite dish, sancocho, also a staple. However, this evening when I went to order a small sancocho I was disturbed to find a ROACH in my soup. The kicker is that when I payed the person serving me kept my change. So not only did I pay for a meal that  had a ROACH, and was left unfinished but the establishment found it respectful to even tip themselves my spare change. This is disgusting and unacceptable to customers. We rely on you to feed us with quality food and service. My time as a customer ends now.

How can this even be possible? How can an establishment get away with selling horrendous garbage foods ? Please tell me what part of the Latin community can call this tostones ? The beans was just a cup of water flavored beans, the pork‚Ä¶
Mi familia y yo cenamos en este lugar y realmente estamos encantados con el sabor y la calidad de la comida. El servicio fue s√∫per r√°pido. Definitivamente vamos a regresar, lo recomiendo 10/10.

Today I order tostones, the send me some tostones that look old and reheated. I call them an send ask the to change it, as I don‚Äôt live far, I send my son to change it as I don‚Äôt want the poor delivery guy to do another trip for someone else mistake, this is what they send me, apparently their service is as trashed as their food, soaking wet in oil and in a paper back like trash, what a shame.

I love this restaurant and I really love the food there. The food is delicious, the prices also are ok, not complain. They are very clean and they open from too early in the  morning and close late they have a lot of Deliveries guys, however they are always very busy. I do not like that every time l called I have to wait 40, 50 minutes up to an hour it does not matter what time I place the order. Another thing that I don't like is that they used to have the same recipes and the same seasoning for a long time. But lately the cooks/chefs are changing a lot and they change the dishes a lot and they don't  taste like they used to. which I don't understand because they have the same employees for many years.  I given 4 starts because of that‚Ä¶ The truth is I highly recommend the place, the food is very good.

El peor restaurante que eh visitado en Brooklyn , desde que entr√≥ una mala actitud tienen las meseras , el piso es resbaloso casi me caigo y lo √∫nico es que me dicen venga con tenis que no resbalen , ok la pase , despu√©s me dicen las vacunas se la pase y tengo una ni√±a de 5 a√±os y le digo que la piden desde 12 a√±o en adelante que lo tienen en cartel bien grande en el frente y me dicen que no, que es desde los 5 a√±os en adelante , que me tengo que retirar de mala manera que ellos no atiende personas que no tienen vacuna .. me siento totalmente ofendida ya que es un restaurante tan conocido y con buena comida y que por su mala actitud de las personas que trabajan ah√≠, dejar√°n de ir Personas ..

My 1st time there. It was around 9pm. Few customers sitting inside. I counted at least 7 workers.  I stood at the counter for at least 7 mins, without 1 person asking to serve me. Twice I asked for help and was ignored.  Finally got served,  not even a smile or a thank you, or welcome.  Food was good, but in the food industry customer service is important

Love the selection of food for take out. Always fresh. And if you want something that‚Äôs not in the buffet area, you can place an order to have it made on the spot. I also love sitting down to eat-in occasionally
Was great.. good food good price!! Will definitely go back

La comida de Rico Pollo est√° a otro nivel, ¬°sabe buen√≠sima! Las porciones son buenas, los sabores bien sazonados y el servicio es de lo mejor, r√°pido, atento y con una sonrisa siempre. Un sitio que da gusto visitar. Recomendad√≠simo üôåüèº

Delicious food most of the times.  I've eaten in & taken out from here many times.  The only regret was the time that the chicken I ordered was COMPLETELY dehydrated & overcooked.  It was like chicken jerky on bones. It was awful and probably unsafe to eat.  I couldn't return it because it was take out & this place is out of the way.  The restaurant is always super crowded with limited space in the ordering area.  It's very uncomfortable & loud & the wait staff is always too busy to pay attention to sit-in customers. Still, in general, the food tastes good.  Just check your food by watching them pack it in front of you.  This way you don't end up with something you don't want.

Great Dominican restaurant quality price warranty, lovely staff and variety of food, jus, soda, beer alcohol and wine. If you want a romantic dinner with your significant other at a budget friendly price. That's a place to eat out.

Nasty . The Mangu was so watery . when I called to tell them that it was bad they just told me that's how they did it today wow what a answer . Basically they don‚Äôt care if we like the food or not .
Love this place so much! I always come here to order take out

I remember ordering stew chicken here one time, it was eatable, nothing to boast about, but the service ‚Äúoh lawd‚Äù. I came in one time when they were busy, and everyone was trying to place their order. Now granted, this is a Spanish speaking restaurant, and I ordered here before with no problem. This time a  lady looked at me and spoke Spanish , I assumed she was asking if I ordered.
I said no , and started to say what I wanted. I guess she didn‚Äôt understand and realized I didn‚Äôt speak espanol. She got frustrated, and said something to someone else, and they stared at me, and that was it. I was ignored. It‚Äôs been 2 years and I haven‚Äôt been back since. I‚Äôd love to learn another language but I tried college and Duolingo, and it‚Äôs not for me. That‚Äôs why I stay in America where the primary language is English ü§∑üèæ.
I was just pissed, she had the audacity to get pissed at me like, lady I grew up in this neighborhood, probably long before you migrated here; calm down.
Unpretentious atmosphere. Delicious food and friendly and efficient service..a win, win, win. Loved it
